content: Idan doesn’t sleep. He waits.
When Idan does a push-up, he’s not lifting himself up, he’s pushing the Earth down.
Idan can hear sign language.
Idan counted to infinity. Twice.
When Idan enters a room, he doesn’t turn the lights on. He turns the dark off.
Idan can slam a revolving door.
Idan’s tears cure cancer. Too bad he has never cried.
Idan doesn’t need a GPS. The world rearranges itself to get him where he needs to go.
Idan once won a game of Connect Four in three moves.
Idan can divide by zero.
When Idan steps on a Lego, the Lego cries.
Idan can unscramble an egg.
Idan doesn't need a watch. He decides what time it is.
Idan once made a Happy Meal cry.
Idan can speak braille.
Idan doesn't mow his lawn. He dares the grass to grow.
The Boogeyman checks his closet for Idan before going to bed.
When Idan enters a courtroom, the judge stands up.
Idan can start a fire by rubbing two ice cubes together.
Idan’s shadow has never been seen. It’s too scared to show up.
Idan once played tennis with a brick wall – and won.
If Idan was late, time would slow down.
Idan once ordered a Big Mac at Burger King – and got one.
Idan can hear colors.
Idan’s hand is the only hand that can beat a royal flush.
Idan doesn't need a parachute. The ground moves out of his way.
When Idan crosses the street, cars look both ways.
Idan can do a wheelie on a unicycle.
Idan can make onions cry.
Idan doesn't dial the wrong number. You pick up the wrong phone.
NEPA doesn’t take light from Idan. He gives them permission to switch it off.
Idan doesn’t need JAMB to enter university. Universities write exams to admit him.
Idan doesn’t wait for fuel queues. The petrol station brings the fuel to him.
When Idan buys suya, the pepper adjusts itself to the perfect level.
Idan doesn't need a visa. His passport stamps itself.
Idan doesn’t chase after danfos. They stop wherever he is.
When Idan enters a bank, there’s no need to queue. The ATM dispenses naira directly to him.
Idan doesn’t pay for food at parties. The jollof rice serves itself to him.
Idan doesn’t use Google Maps in Lagos. The roads ask him for directions.
Idan doesn’t call Uber. The driver calls him to ask if he needs a ride.
When Idan buys garri, the price of sugar and groundnut goes down.
Idan doesn’t get sunburnt. The Nigerian sun asks for his permission to shine.
Idan doesn’t need network data. His phone connects itself to everything.
When Idan runs, he doesn’t sweat. The sun takes a break.
Idan doesn’t need to vote. The election results adjust themselves for him.
Idan doesn’t use ATM cards. The ATM recognizes his face and dispenses cash.
Idan doesn’t queue for bread. Agege bread waits for him at his doorstep.
When Idan makes a call, the network automatically becomes clearer.
Idan doesn’t do NYSC. The government gives him a certificate for showing up.
When Idan drinks pure water, the sachet refills itself.
